parameters.query: AI News & Tools For Content Creators

json.query: AI News & Tools For Content Creators

results.title: Epidemic Sound’s Bold AI Bet, Helping Creators And Paying Artists More - Forbes
results.content: Stockholm-based Epidemic Sound is responding with an AI tool called Adapt that is designed to help creators and musicians. According to the Future of the Creator Economy Report 2025 published by Epidemic Sound, 91% of content creators now use AI in their workflows. Epidemic Sound’s co-founder and CEO Oscar Höglund said in the podcast interview that Adapt was built to support creators. “We do not want to be part of a narrative where we unleash huge amounts of generative AI music to flood the world and diminish the value of music made by incredibly talented artists,” he said. “The idea behind Adapt was to put those tools in the hands of creators so they can make those decisions immediately.”

results.title: OpenAI's Sora Social Media App Is an AI Deepfake Fever Dream - CNET
results.content: Named after its AI video generator, OpenAI's new app is custom-built to create and share AI-generated videos using its upgraded Sora 2 model. Every Sora user can upload their cameo when they make an account and choose whether to let other people use their likeness in AI videos. Sora's cameo ability to "deepfake" anyone who allows their likeness to be used is on a whole new level -- you can't use Meta AI or Adobe Firefly to make a video of their CEOs saying nearly anything, for example. The Sora app highlights how controversial AI media generation tools like image and video generators are among creators.

results.title: Shareable Creator Insights Feature Coming To Instagram 10/02/2025 - MediaPost
results.content: “Shareable Insights” invites Instagram creators to export insights regarding their account and specific campaigns, posts and Reels as a PDF via Meta's Edits app. * YouTube Leads AI Search, 200x More Citations Vs. Other Platforms: Report # YouTube Dominates AI Search, Cited 200x More Than Any Other Platform and Google’s AI search results 200x more than any other video platform, according to data released Wednesday. results show that YouTube receives more citations in Google AI Overviews results than established content authorities like Mayo Clinic and Investopedia. across major search engines and found that YouTube averages a 20% citation share across AI platforms, making it the most-cited video platform. * YouTube Leads AI Search, 200x More Citations Vs.
